definition: the Chartist movement (in the 1840s in England)
Charter 08, PRC pro-democracy petition of December 2008

sentences.english: It was a creed written into the founding documents that declared the destiny of a nation.
sentences.chinese: 這是載於我們的建國憲章的基本信念。

sentences.english: A charter is a mask; the lie lurks beneath it.
sentences.chinese: 憲章是個假面具，蓋在那下面的是謊話。

sentences.english: The Magna Carta is an important document in British law.
sentences.chinese: 大憲章是英國法律上一份重要文件。

sentences.english: These five principles represent the crystallization of the UN Charter.
sentences.chinese: 這五項原則是聯合國憲章的具體表現。

sentences.english: 1215 - Pope Innocent III declares the Magna Carta invalid.
sentences.chinese: 1215年的今天，教皇諾森三世宣佈大憲章無效。

sentences.english: Only authorised users from Charter member countries can request images.
sentences.chinese: 只有憲章成員國的授權用戶才能申請圖像。

sentences.english: Sixty-five years ago on this date, the founding Charter of the United Nations entered into force.
sentences.chinese: 65年前的今天，聯合國的創始憲章開始生效。

sentences.english: Precisely. Talking about taking a little bit of truth and all of a sudden, it's Magna Carta.
sentences.chinese: 準確的來說，冷不丁的來點真理，那就是自由大憲章。

sentences.english: The present Charter shall be ratified by the signatory states in accordance with their respective constitutional processes.
sentences.chinese: 本憲章應由簽字國各依其憲法程序批准之。

sentences.english: King John subscribed to Magna Carta in 1215.
sentences.chinese: 1215年約翰國王在大憲章上籤了名。

sentences.english: It was a  creed written into the founding documents that declared the  destiny of a nation.
sentences.chinese: 它是寫進開國憲章的信條，宣示了這個國家的命運。

sentences.english: A people which accepts a charter abdicates .
sentences.chinese: 人民接受憲章便是退位。

sentences.english: Magna Charta has been rightly regarded as a turning point in English history.
sentences.chinese: 大憲章理所當然地被視爲英國曆史上的轉折點。

sentences.english: In December 1974, the Assembly adopted a Charter of Economic Rights and Duties of States.
sentences.chinese: 一九七四年十二月大會通過了各國經濟權利義務憲章。
我乾脆拒絕你們的那個憲章。

sentences.english: I've had a front-row seat to the charter movement's growth.
sentences.chinese: 我有一對憲章運動的發展前排的座位。

definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to rely on/to base oneself on
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to be in overall charge/to oversee
